Lok Yang TengLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 10 Mar 2019CFD is a complex vehicle for investment, mainly speculation. While there are high possible returns, the risk is non-neglectable. To grow by another 10k in 9 months, you're expecting more than 100% profit per annum. To give you a sense on how much that is, Peter Lynch, regarded as on of the world's best investors, scored about 29.2% annualised rate of return. That is to say you're looking to beat the one of the world's best by 3x.The other possible way with less risk is to have a side job. The pay only needs to be 1k per month which is more feasible.0 comments0
